intro: Vicoa vestita, commonly known as the naked vicoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Vicoa vestita is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and rocky slopes.
